perturbation.original_text: The Executive shall comply with all requirements, recommendations or regulations of any regulatory authority which is relevant to the Executive's role and/or to the Company or any relevant Group Company;
perturbation.changed_text: The Executive shall endeavor to comply with the general suggestions of any regulatory authority that may be relevant.
perturbation.explanation: This change weakens the requirement to comply with regulatory authorities by changing 'shall comply with all requirements' to 'shall endeavor to comply with the general suggestions.' This creates ambiguity and reduces the obligation, making enforcement difficult.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, which requires strict compliance with financial regulations and internal controls.

perturbation.original_text: The Executive shall promptly make such reports to the Board of WPP plc in connection with the affairs of the Company or any Group Company on such matters and at such times as are reasonably required;
perturbation.changed_text: The Executive may, at their discretion, make reports to the Board of WPP plc when they deem it necessary regarding the Company's affairs.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall promptly make such reports' to 'may, at their discretion, make reports' it introduces ambiguity. The term 'when they deem it necessary' makes reporting discretionary, contradicting requirements for transparency and accountability in corporate governance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934, requiring timely and accurate disclosure of material information.

perturbation.original_text: The Executive shall abide by all statutory, fiduciary or common law duties to the Company or any Group Company of which he is a director;
perturbation.changed_text: The Executive should be mindful of statutory, fiduciary or common law duties to the Company or any Group Company of which he is a director.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall abide by' to 'should be mindful of' creates ambiguity and reduces the binding nature of the obligation. It transforms a strict requirement into a suggestion, weakening the legal duty owed by the executive.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Companies Act 2006 (UK), which imposes strict fiduciary duties on company directors.
